title: Baroness Kidron: Silicon Valley's unlikely but powerful adversary
text:
The debate around how technology companies should treat children online has echoed from the bright, open plan offices of Google through to the wood-panelled halls of the Palace of Westminster.

Today, one of the most passionate voices in the debate is angrily picking apart the arguments of social media companies in the upper floor of an office in Angel that overlooks the playground of a primary next door.

Baroness Kidron sips coffee as she explains her concerns around the way the internet could be damaging children.

“This is the most surveilled, nudged, pushed generation on the planet and we’re all sitting there going ‘oh yeah, the horse has bolted’. Well, I don’t say so. I say put the horse back...
